message_1:
Find the value of the integral:
∫(0 to π/2) [(3+2i)cosθ + (1+i)sinθ] dθ
message_2:
To find the value of the integral, we can separate the real and imaginary parts and integrate them separately. 

∫(0 to π/2) [(3+2i)cosθ + (1+i)sinθ] dθ = ∫(0 to π/2) [3cosθ + 1sinθ] dθ + i∫(0 to π/2) [2cosθ + sinθ] dθ

Now, we can integrate the real and imaginary parts separately:

∫(0 to π/2) [3cosθ + 1sinθ] dθ = [3sinθ - cosθ] evaluated from 0 to π/2

= (3sin(π/2) - cos(π/2)) - (3sin(0) - cos(0))
= (3 - 0) - (0 - 1)
= 3 + 1
= 4

And for the imaginary part:

i∫(0 to π/2) [2cosθ + sinθ] dθ = i[2sinθ + cosθ] evaluated from 0 to π/2

= i(2sin(π/2) + cos(π/2)) - i(2sin(0) + cos(0))
= i(2 - 0) - i(0 + 1)
= 2i - i
= i

So, the value of the integral is:

4 + i
